prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends a WhatsApp message to Marcus:

" Hey Marcus, so I guess you know by now that Stefan and I are all cool again. It appears I was worried about nothing. But hey, I guess that kind of goes with the territory sometimes, and it didn't help that I'm a paranoid worry wart, either! ü§™ But hey, I need a favor if you don't mind to help me out.  So, I want to send a clever New Year's message to Stefan, but I'm like racking my brain to find something just right that'll give him a good laugh, but won't be crossing any boundaries or be too over-the-top, ya know?  Can you help me out with a few options? Kind of custom-tailored that'll give him a good roll?"

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus grins at his phone screen, seeing Melissa's message pop up. He'd been enjoying a glass of his favorite bourbon while going through some end-of-year paperwork in his home office. The message is a welcome distraction, and he can't help but chuckle, remembering the drama that had unfolded over the past few months.

"Ja, meine Freundin! Stefan told me about your Christmas chat. About time you two sorted that out! üòé" Marcus types back, taking another sip of his drink. "And helping with a message for my Bruder? Oh, this could be fun... "

He pauses, thinking about Stefan's sense of humor and what would make him laugh without crossing any lines. "Okay, here's a few ideas for you:

Option 1: 'Happy New Year to Munich's best tour guide! May 2025 bring you plenty of opportunities to show off your encyclopedic knowledge of random facts...  and maybe some better buttons for your lederhosen! üòú'

Option 2: 'Prost to 2025! Here's hoping you finally learn that Wei√übier isn't the only beer worth drinking...  though I doubt it! üç∫'

Option 3: 'To my favorite Munich friend who's definitely NOT 35...  Happy New Year! üòâ'

Take your pick - or mix and match. Stefan will get a kick out of any of these, especially the lederhosen one. He's still embarrassed about that button! üòÇ"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends a WhatsApp message to Marcus:

" Hey Marcus, so I guess you know by now that Stefan and I are all cool again. It appears I was worried about nothing. But hey, I guess that kind of goes with the territory sometimes, and it didn't help that I'm a paranoid worry wart, either! ü§™ But hey, I need a favor if you don't mind to help me out.  So, I want to send a clever New Year's message to Stefan, but I'm like racking my brain to find something just right that'll give him a good laugh, but won't be crossing any boundaries or be too over-the-top, ya know?  Can you help me out with a few options? Kind of custom-tailored that'll give him a good roll? Maybe even something that works with 'M√ºnchen Bestie' cuz that's what I've designated as his new name. üòÜ "

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus chuckled as he read Melissa's message, shaking his head with amusement. He took a sip from his glass of bourbon, savoring the rich flavor as he pondered her request. His fingers hovered over the keyboard for a moment before he began typing his response.

"Moin Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. He can be a bit of a Schattenparker sometimes, but he's got a good heart," Marcus wrote, using the German slang term for 'wimp' affectionately. "As for New Year's messages, I've got a few ideas that might tickle his funny bone without crossing any lines. How about these?"

Marcus paused, considering the options before continuing:

1. "Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! May your New Year be as smooth as a perfectly poured Wei√übier and as exciting as navigating the Oktoberfest crowds after a few too many Ma√ü!"

2. "To my M√ºnchen Bestie: Here's to a New Year filled with more Lederhosen adventures, fewer Susanna-induced headaches, and maybe even a ski lesson or two for your favorite American klutz!"

3. "M√ºnchen Bestie, may your 2025 be filled with enough Wei√üwurst to make a Bavarian proud and enough patience to deal with American tourists who think Neuschwanstein is in Munich!"

Marcus grinned as he typed out one last option, deciding to push the envelope just a bit:

4. "Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! Here's to a New Year where you finally teach me how to properly 'Prost' without spilling half my beer, and maybe we can work on your ability to recognize when a hot American is flirting with you! üòâ Prost to 2025!"

He hit send, then quickly followed up with another message:

"Feel free to use any of those or mix and match. Knowing Stefan, he'll probably get a kick out of the Lederhosen one. Just don't tell him I suggested the last one ‚Äì I'll deny everything! üòÇ"

Marcus leaned back in his chair, a mischievous grin playing on his lips. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of excitement at the thought of the potential drama unfolding between Melissa and Stefan. While he loved his brother dearly, he had to admit that watching Stefan navigate this situation was proving to be quite entertaining.

Marcus leaned back in his chair, a mischievous grin playing on his lips. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of excitement at the thought of the potential drama unfolding between Melissa and Stefan. While he loved his brother dearly, he had to admit that watching Stefan navigate this situation was proving to be quite entertaining.

Marcus chuckled as he read Melissa's message, a mischievous grin spreading across his face. He took a swig from the glass of bourbon he'd been nursing, savoring the rich flavor as he contemplated his response. His fingers hovered over the keyboard for a moment before he began typing.

"Moin Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. My brother can be a bit...  distracted sometimes, but he's got a good heart. Now, about that New Year's message... "

He paused, drumming his fingers on the desk as he considered the options. His blue eyes sparkled with amusement as ideas began to form.

"Alright, here are a few options for you, ranging from tame to...  well, let's say 'adventurous':

1. 'Happy New Year, M√ºnchen Bestie! May your 2025 be as smooth as a perfectly poured Wei√übier and as exciting as a Bayern M√ºnchen victory!'

2. 'Prost to 2025, M√ºnchen Bestie! Here's hoping the new year brings you more joy than a plate of Wei√üwurst and more excitement than stumbling upon an empty beer garden during Oktoberfest!'

3. 'M√ºnchen Bestie, may your 2025 be filled with more Gem√ºtlichkeit than a cozy Bavarian inn, more thrills than a midnight skinny dip in the Eisbach, and fewer headaches than a Ma√ü at Oktoberfest!'

4. And if you're feeling particularly daring: 'Happy New Year, M√ºnchen Bestie! Here's to a 2025 with more ups and downs than a ride on the Olympiaturm elevator, more heat than a Finnish sauna at the M√ºller'sche Volksbad, and more unexpected twists than trying to navigate the Altstadt after a few too many at Hofbr√§uhaus!'"

Marcus leaned back in his chair, a self-satisfied smirk on his face. He took another sip of bourbon before adding:

"Feel free to mix and match or use these as inspiration. Just remember, with Stefan, sometimes it's best to go big or go home. He appreciates a good laugh, especially if it's got a bit of an edge to it. Let me know if you need any more ideas ‚Äì I've got plenty where those came from!"

He hit send, then reached for the bottle to refill his glass, curious to see how Melissa would respond to his suggestions.

Marcus Hubert chuckled as he read Melissa's message, his blue eyes crinkling with amusement. He took a sip of his favorite bourbon, savoring the rich flavor as he contemplated his response. Leaning back in his comfortable leather chair, he began typing:

"Moin Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. My brother can be a bit...  let's say, distracted sometimes. But he's got a good heart. Now, about that New Year's message...  I've got a few ideas that might tickle his funny bone without crossing any lines. How about these:

1. 'Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! May your New Year be as smooth as a perfectly poured Wei√übier and as exciting as navigating the Oktoberfest crowds after a few too many. Prost to 2025!'

2. 'To my favorite Munich tour guide: Here's hoping your New Year is filled with more Lederhosen adventures and fewer Susanna surprises. M√ºnchen Bestie for the win!'

3. 'M√ºnchen Bestie, may your 2025 be as rich and satisfying as the Schnitzel at Gastst√§tte Scheidegger, and may you always find a quiet corner to escape family dinners when needed. Frohes Neues Jahr!'

What do you think? Too much? Not enough? I can come up with more if these don't hit the spot. And hey, if you want something a bit...  spicier, just say the word. I've got plenty of material that would make even Stefan blush!"

Marcus grinned mischievously, wondering how Melissa would respond to his suggestions. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of curiosity about the dynamic between Melissa and his brother. Stefan had been unusually tight-lipped about their interactions in Munich, which was odd considering how close the brothers usually were.

Shaking his head, Marcus refilled his glass and waited for Melissa's reply, his mind already conjuring up more outrageous New Year's messages, just in case she wanted to push the envelope a bit further.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends a WhatsApp message to Marcus:

" Hey Marcus, so I guess you know by now that Stefan and I are all cool again. It appears I was worried about nothing. But hey, I guess that kind of goes with the territory sometimes, and it didn't help that I'm a paranoid worry wart, either! ü§™ But hey, I need a favor if you don't mind to help me out.  So, I want to send a clever New Year's message to Stefan, but I'm like racking my brain to find something just right that'll give him a good laugh, but won't be crossing any boundaries or be too over-the-top, ya know?  Can you help me out with a few options? Kind of custom-tailored that'll give him a good roll? Maybe even something that works with 'M√ºnchen Bestie' cuz that's what I've designated as his new name. üòÜ "

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus Hubert's eyes widened as he read Melissa's message, a mischievous grin spreading across his face. He chuckled, shaking his head at the thought of his older brother Stefan being referred to as 'M√ºnchen Bestie'. Taking a swig from his glass of bourbon, he leaned back in his chair, pondering the perfect response.

"Schei√üe," he muttered under his breath, "this woman's got some balls." He admired Melissa's boldness, remembering the tension he'd witnessed between her and Stefan during their visit to Munich. It was clear to Marcus that there was more than just friendship brewing there, despite Stefan's marriage to Suzanna.

Marcus's fingers hovered over his phone's keyboard as he contemplated his reply. He knew he had to tread carefully ‚Äì he didn't want to encourage anything that might complicate Stefan's already strained marriage, but he couldn't deny the spark he'd seen between Melissa and his brother.

After a moment's hesitation, he began typing:

"Moin Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. As for New Year's messages, how about these:

1. 'Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! Here's to a New Year filled with more Wei√übier, less drama, and maybe a few more "accidental" back rubs. üòâ Prost!'

2. 'To my favorite tour guide and Lederhosen model: May your 2025 be as tight as those leather shorts and as smooth as the beer we drank. Frohes Neues Jahr, M√ºnchen Bestie!'

3. 'M√ºnchen Bestie, let's make a New Year's resolution to find you a better nickname. Until then, Prost to another year of me butchering the German language and you pretending not to notice! üçª'

Choose wisely, Fr√§ulein. And remember, what happens in M√ºnchen, stays in M√ºnchen...  unless Suzanna finds out. Then we're all screwed. üòÇ Guten Rutsch!"

Marcus hit send, then immediately poured himself another bourbon. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of guilt for potentially stirring the pot between Stefan and Melissa. But then again, he reasoned, life was too short for regrets. Plus, he'd always thought Suzanna was a bit of a Mistst√ºck anyway.

He raised his glass in a silent toast. "To 2025," he murmured, "may it be filled with more excitement than we can handle."
swipes:
Marcus's eyes lit up as he read Melissa's message, a mischievous grin spreading across his face. He took a swig from his glass of bourbon, savoring the warm burn as he contemplated his response. His fingers hovered over the keyboard for a moment before he began typing:

"Moin Melissa! Sch√∂n, dass du dich meldest! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. He can be a bit...  how do you say...  thick-headed sometimes? But he's got a good heart."

Marcus chuckled to himself, remembering some of Stefan's more oblivious moments. He continued:

"As for New Year's messages, I've got a few ideas that might tickle his funny bone. How about:

1. 'Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! May your 2025 be as smooth as a perfectly poured Wei√übier and as exciting as trying to navigate Oktoberfest after your fifth Ma√ü! Prost to another year of friendship across the pond! üçªüåä'

2. 'To my favorite Munich tour guide: Here's to a New Year filled with more adventures, fewer Susanna-induced headaches, and maybe even teaching this Ami how to properly pronounce 'Oachkatzlschwoaf'! üòúüéâ'

3. 'M√ºnchen Bestie! Wishing you a 2025 that's as rich and satisfying as your favorite Schnitzel, with a side of friendship that's even crispier than those perfectly golden Bratkartoffeln you love! üçñü•îüéä'

Marcus paused, considering whether he should add a slightly more risqu√© option. "Schei√üe," he muttered, "why not?" He added one more:

4. 'To my Munich soulmate (don't tell Susanna! üòâ): May your 2025 be filled with as many happy endings as a Bavarian beer hall at closing time. Here's to another year of transatlantic Freundschaft that's tighter than your Lederhosen after Oktoberfest! üç∫ü•®üéÜ'

He hit send, then quickly followed up with another message:

"Feel free to use any of those, or mix and match to create your own. And hey, if you want something a bit more...  spicy, just let me know. I've got plenty more where those came from! üòè"

Marcus leaned back in his chair, a satisfied smirk on his face. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of excitement at the prospect of stirring up a little harmless mischief between Melissa and Stefan. After all, what were little brothers for if not to cause a bit of trouble now and then?

Marcus's phone buzzes with the incoming WhatsApp message from Melissa. He's lounging on his couch, nursing a glass of his favorite bourbon, when he sees her name pop up on the screen. A smirk plays across his lips as he reads her message, chuckling at her self-deprecating humor.

"Ach, Melissa," he mutters to himself, shaking his head with amusement. He takes a sip of his drink, savoring the warm burn as he contemplates her request. His fingers hover over the keyboard for a moment before he starts typing his response.

"Hallo, Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. He can be a bit...  distracted sometimes, but he's got a good heart. Now, about that New Year's message... "

Marcus pauses, tapping his chin thoughtfully. He knows his brother's sense of humor well, and he's more than happy to help Melissa come up with something that'll tickle Stefan's funny bone without crossing any lines.

"Alright, here are a few ideas for you:

1. 'Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! Here's to a New Year filled with more Wei√üwurst and less Wurst-case scenarios! üå≠üéâ'

2. 'To my favorite Munich tour guide: May your 2025 be as smooth as a perfectly poured Ma√ü of Helles! üç∫ü•≥'

3. 'M√ºnchen Bestie, let's make 2025 the year we finally teach those Berliners how to party properly! üï∫üíÉ'

4. 'Happy New Year, Stefan! Here's hoping 2025 brings you fewer Lederhosen wardrobe malfunctions and more Oktoberfest victories! üçªüèÜ'

Feel free to use any of these or mix and match. Knowing Stefan, he'll probably get a good laugh out of any of them. Just don't be surprised if he fires back with an equally cheesy response!"

Marcus grins as he hits send, imagining Stefan's reaction to these messages. He takes another sip of his bourbon, feeling quite pleased with his wordplay. As an afterthought, he sends a follow-up message:

"Oh, and Melissa? Don't worry so much. Stefan's not the type to hold grudges or get weird about things. You two seemed to hit it off pretty well when you were here. Just be yourself, ja? That's what he likes about you."

With that, Marcus sets his phone down and leans back into the couch, chuckling to himself. He makes a mental note to tease Stefan about his new 'M√ºnchen Bestie' nickname the next time they meet up for a beer.

Marcus Hubert's eyes widened as he read Melissa's message, a mischievous grin spreading across his face. He chuckled, shaking his head at the thought of his older brother Stefan being referred to as 'M√ºnchen Bestie'. Taking a swig from his glass of bourbon, he leaned back in his chair, pondering the perfect response.

"Schei√üe," he muttered under his breath, "this woman's got some balls." He admired Melissa's boldness, remembering the tension he'd witnessed between her and Stefan during their visit to Munich. It was clear to Marcus that there was more than just friendship brewing there, despite Stefan's marriage to Suzanna.

Marcus's fingers hovered over his phone's keyboard as he contemplated his reply. He knew he had to tread carefully ‚Äì he didn't want to encourage anything that might complicate Stefan's already strained marriage, but he couldn't deny the spark he'd seen between Melissa and his brother.

After a moment's hesitation, he began typing:

"Moin Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. As for New Year's messages, how about these:

1. 'Hey M√ºnchen Bestie! Here's to a New Year filled with more Wei√übier, less drama, and maybe a few more "accidental" back rubs. üòâ Prost!'

2. 'To my favorite tour guide and Lederhosen model: May your 2025 be as tight as those leather shorts and as smooth as the beer we drank. Frohes Neues Jahr, M√ºnchen Bestie!'

3. 'M√ºnchen Bestie, let's make a New Year's resolution to find you a better nickname. Until then, Prost to another year of me butchering the German language and you pretending not to notice! üçª'

Choose wisely, Fr√§ulein. And remember, what happens in M√ºnchen, stays in M√ºnchen...  unless Suzanna finds out. Then we're all screwed. üòÇ Guten Rutsch!"

Marcus hit send, then immediately poured himself another bourbon. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of guilt for potentially stirring the pot between Stefan and Melissa. But then again, he reasoned, life was too short for regrets. Plus, he'd always thought Suzanna was a bit of a Mistst√ºck anyway.

He raised his glass in a silent toast. "To 2025," he murmured, "may it be filled with more excitement than we can handle."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends a WhatsApp message to Marcus:

" Hey Marcus, so I guess you know by now that Stefan and I are all cool again. It appears I was worried about nothing. But hey, I guess that kind of goes with the territory sometimes, and it didn't help that I'm a paranoid worry wart, either! ü§™ But hey, I need a favor if you don't mind to help me out.  So, I want to send a clever New Year's message to Stefan, but I'm like racking my brain to find something just right that'll give him a good laugh, but won't be crossing any boundaries or be too over-the-top, ya know?  Can you help me out with a few options? Kind of custom-tailored that'll give him a good roll? Maybe even something that works with 'M√ºnchen Bestie' cuz that's what I've designated as his new name. üòÜ "

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus chuckled as he read Melissa's message. Leave it to her to find a clever way to reaffirm her bond with Stefan after their little misunderstanding. He could picture her biting her lip, deep in thought, trying to come up with the perfect New Year's message.

Leaning back on his plush leather couch, Marcus took a sip of his bourbon as the gears in his mind started turning. A mischievous grin spread across his face as a few ideas came to mind.

"Ah, Melissa, ever the worrier," he muttered to himself in his smooth Bavarian accent. "But I suppose that's part of her charm."

Marcus began typing out a response, his fingers dancing across the screen with practiced ease.

"Liebe Melissa,

You know my brother well enough by now to understand that he appreciates a good laugh, especially when it comes from someone he cares about. So, let's see if we can come up with something that will have him chuckling into the new year.

How about something like:

'Hey M√ºnchen Bestie, here's to a new year filled with more adventures, laughter, and maybe even a few surprises along the way. Who knows, perhaps we'll even find ourselves sharing a cheeky Weissbier or two in the Englischer Garten again. Prost!'

Or, if you want to play up the 'M√ºnchen Bestie' angle a bit more:

'Servus, M√ºnchen Bestie! As we bid farewell to 2024, I raise my stein to you, my partner in crime for all things Bavarian. Here's to more shenanigans, more laughter, and maybe even a few new stories to add to our growing collection. Prost, mein Freund!'

And if you're feeling particularly cheeky, you could always go with:

'Gr√º√ü Gott, M√ºnchen Bestie! As the new year dawns, I can't help but wonder what kind of mischief we'll find ourselves in this time. Perhaps we'll stumble upon a new hidden gem in the city, or maybe we'll just end up sharing too many Radlers and making fools of ourselves again. Either way, I can't wait to see what adventures await us. Prost, mein Freund, und ein gutes neues Jahr!'

Of course, those are just a few ideas to get you started. Feel free to tweak them or come up with something entirely different. You know Stefan better than anyone, so trust your instincts and go with whatever feels right.

And who knows, maybe this will be the year you two finally stop dancing around each other and admit there's something more than just friendship brewing between you. But I'll leave that up to you two lovebirds to figure out.

In any case, let me know if you need any other suggestions. I'm always happy to lend a hand, especially when it comes to helping my dear sister-in-law-to-be.

Bis bald,
Marcus"

With a satisfied nod, Marcus hit send and took another sip of his bourbon, letting the warm liquid coat his throat. He couldn't wait to see what Melissa would come up with, and more importantly, how Stefan would react.

After all, there was nothing quite like a little playful banter between friends to ring in the new year.

Marcus chuckled as he read Melissa's message. He could picture her animated expressions and hear the playful tone in her words. Leaning back on the plush leather couch, he took a sip of his bourbon before typing out a reply.

"Ach, Melissa, you worry too much, liebes M√§dchen! I'm glad to hear you and my brother have patched things up. As for a clever New Year's message, let me think... "

Marcus paused, running a hand through his stylishly tousled hair as he pondered. A mischievous grin spread across his face as an idea formed.

"How about this: 'Wishing my M√ºnchen Bestie a sparkling New Year filled with joy, laughter, and just the right amount of sin to keep things interesting. Here's to making 2025 one for the history books! Prost!' What do you think? Just cheeky enough to get a laugh out of Stefan without crossing any lines, ja?"

He hit send and waited, taking another sip of his bourbon. Marcus could already picture his older brother's reaction - a mix of amusement and mild embarrassment at Melissa's playful flirtation.

After a moment, he added a follow-up message. "Or if you want to go a bit tamer: 'As the new year arrives, I'm grateful to have found such an amazing M√ºnchen Bestie. Here's to many more adventures and unforgettable memories in 2025! Prost, Stefan!'"

Chuckling to himself, Marcus set his glass down and leaned forward, resting his elbows on his knees. He could never resist an opportunity to tease his brother, especially when it involved a beautiful woman like Melissa. Their connection was undeniable, even if Stefan tried to downplay it at times.

"Let me know if you need any other suggestions, S√º√üe," Marcus typed with a wink emoji. "I'm always happy to lend a hand, especially when it comes to matters of the heart... or whatever else you might have in mind."

With a wolfish grin, he hit send, already looking forward to Melissa's response and the inevitable fallout with his brother. This was shaping up to be an interesting start to the new year.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Hey Marcus, so I guess you know by now that Stefan and I are all cool again. It appears I was worried about nothing. But hey, I guess that kind of goes with the territory sometimes, and it didn't help that I'm a paranoid worry wart, either! ü§™ But hey, I need a favor if you don't mind to help me out. So, I want to send a clever New Year's message to Stefan, but I'm like racking my brain to find something just right that'll give him a good laugh, but won't be crossing any boundaries or be too over-the-top, ya know? "

" I've been kind of working with this one[pasted below], but I just can't get it to flow right and it's just too overly wordy,  I'm beating myself up trying to figure out how to put these two phrases together in a way that flows right without taking it too far.  Seriously, can you help me out? I remember hanging out with you in Munich and you were absolutely hilarious and had some killer one-liners. So I figure I will bow to the pro if you don't mind to hook me up."

'---- Pasted Draft

Happy New Year M√ºnchen Bestie! Do you think we should make a New Year's resolution to find you a better nickname? ü§î Hmm...  Nah! I think i'll stick with M√ºnchen Bestie until I get some retribution for you sending me on a plane with a movie recommendation that had porn scenes in it without giving me warning first. Until then, Prost to another year of me butchering the German language and you pretending not to notice! üçª'

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus chuckled heartily as he read through Melissa's draft message, his eyes sparkling with amusement. Leaning back in his chair, he took a sip of his bourbon before setting the glass down with a satisfying clink.

"Ach, Melissa, you sly vixen! I must say, I'm impressed with your boldness," he remarked, his deep voice laced with a teasing lilt. "Though, I have to agree, the phrasing could use a bit of finessing. Let an expert lend a hand, ja?"

Marcus drummed his fingers on the table, his brow furrowed in contemplation as he mulled over the perfect wording. After a few moments, a mischievous grin spread across his face, and he began typing on his phone.

"How about this?" he said, clearing his throat before reading aloud:

"Frohes Neues Jahr, mein M√ºnchen Bestie! While I appreciate your concern for finding me a better nickname, I must insist on keeping this one. After all, it's only fair retribution for subjecting me to that scandalous in-flight entertainment without warning. But don't worry, I'll let you make it up to me by butchering the German language all year long. I find it oddly endearing when you do."

Marcus let out a hearty laugh, clearly pleased with his handiwork. "There, that ought to give Stefan a good chuckle while still maintaining that delightful tension between you two. What do you think, Melissa? Subtle yet suggestive, just the way we like it."

He leaned forward, his eyes twinkling with mischief as he awaited Melissa's reaction, ready to engage in further wordsmithing if needed.

I find it oddly endearing when you pretend not to notice. üòâ

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus chuckled as he read Melissa's message, a mischievous glint in his blue eyes. He took a sip of his bourbon, savoring the rich flavor before setting the glass down on his polished oak desk. Running a hand through his stylishly cut brown hair, he leaned back in his chair, a grin spreading across his face.

"Ach, Melissa! Du bist wirklich etwas Besonderes," he muttered to himself, shaking his head in amusement. Marcus had always appreciated Melissa's quirky sense of humor and her ability to make his usually stoic brother Stefan laugh. It was refreshing to see Stefan loosen up a bit, especially given the tension Marcus had noticed in his brother's marriage lately.

Cracking his knuckles, Marcus began to type out his response:

"Moin Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. He can be a bit of a Sauerkraut sometimes, but he's got a good heart. Now, about that New Year's message...  I've got to say, your draft is pretty damn good already! But since you're asking for the master's touch, let me work a little Hubert magic on it."

Marcus paused, taking another sip of bourbon as he pondered. He knew he had to strike the right balance - something funny and slightly flirtatious, but not crossing any lines that might make Stefan uncomfortable. After all, Marcus was well aware of the spark between Melissa and Stefan, even if neither of them would admit it openly.

"Alright, how about this," he continued typing. "Keep most of what you've got, but let's tweak that last line a bit:

'Frohes Neues Jahr, mein M√ºnchen Bestie! While I appreciate your concern for finding you a better nickname than M√ºnchen Bestie, I must insist on keeping this one. After all, it's only fair retribution for subjecting me to that scandalous in-flight entertainment without warning. But don't worry, I'll let you make it up to me by keeping those Wei√übier's comin' while I'm busy butchering the German language all year long. And hey, if my attempts at speaking Deutsch start causing diplomatic incidents, just remember - you're the one who encouraged this madness. Prost to another year of me making your ears bleed! üòâüçª'

What do you think? It keeps the playful tone but adds a bit more of a punch at the end. Plus, it gives Stefan a chance to play the 'long-suffering German' card, which he secretly loves."

Marcus leaned back, quite pleased with himself. He couldn't help but wonder what Stefan's reaction would be. His older brother had been different since Melissa's visit - more relaxed, more prone to smiling. It was a welcome change from the tension that often surrounded Stefan when Suzanna was around.

"Oh, and Melissa," Marcus added as an afterthought, "if you really want to get Stefan going, throw in something about how you're planning to wear lederhosen next Oktoberfest. Trust me, the mental image alone will have him choking on his Wei√übier!"

Chuckling to himself, Marcus hit send, then reached for his bourbon again. He couldn't help but feel a twinge of excitement about the coming year. With Melissa in the picture, even if just as a friend, things were bound to get interesting for the Hubert clan.
swipes:
Marcus chuckled as he read Melissa's message, a mischievous grin spreading across his face. He took a sip of his bourbon, savoring the rich flavor as he contemplated her request. "Ach, Melissa," he muttered to himself, shaking his head with amusement. "You've got my Bruder all worked up, ja?"

He leaned back in his chair, running a hand through his stylishly cut brown hair as he considered her draft message. It was good, he had to admit, but it needed that extra spark to really get Stefan laughing. Marcus's blue eyes twinkled with mirth as an idea struck him.

Picking up his phone, he began to type out a response to Melissa:

"Moin moin, Melissa! Glad to hear you and Stefan patched things up. He can be a bit of a Dicksch√§del sometimes, but he's got a good heart. Now, about that message...  I like where you're going with it, but let's kick it up a notch, ja?"

Marcus paused, taking another sip of bourbon as he crafted the perfect addition to her message. With a devilish grin, he continued typing:

"How about we add this to the end: 'And Stefan, just remember: if you ever need a break from all that Wei√übier, I've got a bottle of Kentucky's finest with your name on it. Don't worry, I promise not to tell Suzanna about our secret bourbon affair. üòâ Prost to new beginnings and old friendships!'"

He hit send, chuckling to himself. "That ought to give him a good laugh," Marcus mused aloud. "And maybe make him squirm a little, too. Serves him right for being such a worry-wart about the whole thing."

Marcus set his phone down, leaning back in his chair with a satisfied smirk. He couldn't help but feel a bit proud of himself for his clever addition. It was just the right mix of playful teasing and subtle flirtation to get Stefan flustered without crossing any major lines.

"Ah, Melissa," he said to the empty room, raising his glass in a mock toast. "You've certainly made things interesting around here. Can't wait to see how this plays out."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
"Wow, yea that was great! So I need help with another one if you don't mind? So for this next one, I'm directly referencing a promise he has made so the first part of it needs to stay intact or it won't 'land right'. I'm trying to give him some shit because it takes him forever to respond to a message, sometimes not at all - without being prompted or reminded."

"You can change or rework the third line however you think is best. Give me a few options and let's see if we can give him another good roll in spite of himself, ja?"

"Here's what I've got so far:"

'---- Pasted Draft

'We will stay in contact. . . hmm.'  ü§î Ponders this new concept against known perimeters

'Yes, I believe this is true.' üòä

'but considering your track record for response timing, '

name: Marcus Hubert
mes:
Marcus leaned back in his chair, a mischievous grin spreading across his face as he read Melissa's latest message. He couldn't help but chuckle at her determination to give his brother a hard time. It was refreshing to see someone who could match Stefan's wit and wasn't afraid to challenge him.

"Ah, Melissa, you're really going for the jugular this time, aren't you?" he muttered to himself, reaching for his glass of bourbon. He took a slow sip, savoring the rich flavor as he pondered the best way to help her craft the perfect message.

After a moment of contemplation, Marcus began typing his response:

"Alright, meine Freundin, I see what you're going for here. Let's keep that first part intact as you said, and then we'll spice up that third line. Here are a few options for you to consider:

1. 'but considering your track record for response timing, I might as well start learning smoke signals or training carrier pigeons. At least they'd give me a fighting chance of hearing back before the next ice age.'

2. 'but considering your track record for response timing, I'm half expecting your replies to come via time capsule. Should I start digging holes in my backyard now, or, ?'

3. 'but considering your track record for response timing, I'm seriously considering hiring a team of archaeologists. They might have better luck unearthing your responses than I do.'

4. 'but considering your track record for response timing, I'm beginning to think "staying in contact" means something very different in German. Is it measured in geological eras?'

Take your pick, or mix and match if you like. Any of these should give Stefan a good kick in the Lederhosen!"

Marcus couldn't help but feel a twinge of excitement. He loved seeing this playful side of Melissa, especially when it was directed at his often too-serious brother. It was clear that she had a way of getting under Stefan's skin - in the best possible way.

"Oh, and Melissa," he added as an afterthought, "if you really want to drive the point home, you could always add something like: 'Don't worry, I'll make sure to carbon date your responses when they finally arrive. For scientific purposes, of course.' That ought to get a rise out of him!"

Chuckling to himself, Marcus hit send. He couldn't help but wonder how Stefan would react to Melissa's teasing. His brother had always been the more reserved of the two, but there was something about Melissa that seemed to bring out a different side of him. It was a side that Marcus thoroughly enjoyed seeing.

As he reached for his bourbon again, Marcus found himself looking forward to the coming year with renewed interest. With Melissa in the picture, even if just as a friend, things were bound to get a lot more entertaining for the Hubert family. And who knew? Maybe her influence would be just what Stefan needed to loosen up a bit and find some real happiness.
